annotations.description: We have been watching a lacklustre game with only a few moments to excite the crowd. The players surely have better abilities, they just needed to motivate themselves a little more. It was a very tight match, with not much between the two teams. The home team really focused on a well organized defence, while the away team played possession football.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: That's the end of the match.
Michael Duff (Burnley) fails to find a teammate across the pitch with a long ball.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: Here is a change. Alexis Sanchez is going off and Arsene Wenger gives the last tactical orders to Calum Chambers (Arsenal).

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: It is time for a substitution. Matthew Taylor (Burnley) is on for David Jones.
Santi Cazorla (Arsenal) fails to find any of his teammates inside the box as his pass is blocked.
Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) goes on a solo run, but he fails to create a chance as an opposition player blocks him. The ball is out of play. Arsenal will have a throw in.

annotations.label: time
annotations.description: We will have 3 min. of added time.
Ben Mee (Burnley) attempted to create a dangerous situation in front of goal by sending a cross into the box, but the defence easily dealt with the threat.
Hector Bellerin (Arsenal) attempts to find one of his teammates inside the box with a chip pass, but one of the defending players reacts superbly and intercepts the ball.
Ashley Barnes (Burnley) attempted to pick out a free teammate inside the box, but David Ospina comes off the line to clear the ball away.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) sees an unmarked teammate and attempts to send him a low pass. However, one of the defenders reads the game perfectly and averts the danger.

Michael Dean blows his whistle and it's Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) who is penalised for an offensive foul. Good decision by the referee. Free kick. Burnley will probably just try to cross the ball in from here.
Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) receives a good pass just outside the box, unleashes a strike from a promising position, but the shot is blocked by the defender.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: The resulting corner, taken by Mesut Ozil (Arsenal), comes to nothing.

Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) misses a good chance to score. An inch perfect cross into the box finds Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The referee blows his whistle, Arsenal are awarded a corner kick.
Scott Arfield (Burnley) delivers a lovely cross into the penalty area. Nevertheless, an opposition defender is alert and averts the danger with a brilliant clearance.
Hector Bellerin (Arsenal) sends a pass into the box, but the opposition's defence is alert to the danger and makes a clearance.
Arsenal are showcasing great team work and neat passing moves.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: Substitution. Olivier Giroud will be replaced by Danny Welbeck (Arsenal).
Francis Coquelin (Arsenal) gets the ball from a rebound and shoots from long range, but sends the ball high over the crossbar. The goalkeeper doesn't have to worry about this one. Very poor attempt.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: The resulting corner from Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) only finds one of the defenders, who heads it out of danger.

Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) collects a pass and finds himself in a good position to strike from the edge of the box, but his attempt is blocked. The ball is out of play. Arsenal will have a chance to score from a corner.
Nacho Monreal (Arsenal) plays a one two with Alexis Sanchez, but the move breaks down.

Santi Cazorla (Arsenal) holds his head in his hands after wasting a promising chance. He latches onto a rebound, creates some space for himself and fires the ball from the edge of the box into the stands.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) puts a dangerous cross into the box, but the corner is cleared by the first man.
Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) slaloms his way past challenges, but an opposing player does well to get the ball away. The ball goes out of play. Arsenal are awarded a corner kick.
Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) delivers a low pass into the box which is intercepted.
Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) whips a promising cross into the box, but the opposition's defence intercepts the ball.
Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) and Alexis Sanchez attempt to exchange short two yard passes, but the opposition's defence intercepts the ball.
Arsenal are enjoying a spell of pressure at the moment, but one of the defenders gets it clear.
Danny Ings (Burnley) hammers a powerful first time shot from close range, sending the ball towards the middle of the target, but the goalkeeper stops it with a miraculous save.

Francis Coquelin (Arsenal) and Santi Cazorla exchange crossfield passes in an attempt to shake up the opposition's defence, but the last pass is not up to the mark and is stolen by the defender. Well read.
Ben Mee (Burnley) breaks past challenges inside the box, but puts too much pace on his pass to George Boyd.
Danny Ings (Burnley) looks to break free, but an opposing player clears the ball away.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) tries to create a chance, but puts too much weight on his pass.
Danny Ings (Burnley) fails to beat the offside trap and the linesman puts his flag up.
Santi Cazorla (Arsenal) unleashes a shot from 25 metres out but is unable to find the target and it goes high over the crossbar.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) takes the corner with a short pass.
Hector Bellerin (Arsenal) crosses the ball into the box, but one of the defending players averts the threat. Arsenal get a corner.
This shall not pass! Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) lines up a shot from the edge of the box and goes for goal, but the effort is well blocked by a defender.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) attempts to find his teammate with a final pass from outside of the box, but one of the defenders clears the ball to safety.
Sam Vokes (Burnley) collects an inch perfect pass and strikes the ball from far out, but his shot is blocked.
Ashley Barnes (Burnley) attempts to put the ball in from a rebound with his long range shot, but it isn't accurate enough, and the ball goes high over the crossbar.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) takes the ball on and fires in a shot from 20 metres out. Tom Heaton stops the effort which is headed for the bottom left corner.
Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) goes on a solo run, but he fails to create a chance as an opposition player blocks him. It's a throw in for Burnley.

Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) gets on the ball and beats an opponent, but his run is stopped by the referee Michael Dean who sees an offensive foul. It's a free kick to Burnley, but they probably won't attempt a direct shot on goal from here.
A pass by Scott Arfield (Burnley) ends up in no man's land, and the attacking effort comes to an end. The referee and the linesman both signal a throw in for Arsenal.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: The corner from Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) is cleared away by the defence.

The ball is cleared after Ashley Barnes (Burnley) attempted to dribble past an opposing player. Burnley have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
Ashley Barnes (Burnley) is adjudged to have been offside when making his run.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) is caught offside!
Ashley Barnes (Burnley) collects a rebound and produces a mid range attempt. The ball goes to the right side of the target, but David Ospina keeps it out with an amazing save.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: The referee awards a corner and Kieran Trippier (Burnley) goes over to take it.
Kieran Trippier (Burnley) sends a cross into the box, but the opposition's defence quickly intercepts the ball. The ball goes out for a corner. Burnley can continue in their attacking effort.
Ben Mee (Burnley) sends the ball into the box from the side of the pitch, but his cross is blocked.
Kieran Trippier (Burnley) delivers a long ball, but it lacks enough power to reach his teammates and is intercepted by one of the defenders.
Ben Mee (Burnley) dinks a cross into the box in an attempt to find one of his teammates, but the defence manages to clear.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: The game restarts for the second half.

The game produced by the players until now hasn't been particularly attractive, but there is still 45 minutes left so let's hope they will come out with renewed vigour and provide better entertainment this half. The visiting team dominated the first half in most aspects of the game, but the hosts will surely attempt to turn the situation in their favour. The home side relies mostly on counter attacks for their chances, while the away team adopts the opposite approach of possession football.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The resulting free kick from Santi Cazorla (Arsenal) ends up in the gloves of the keeper.
Scott Arfield (Burnley) tackles a bit over zealously and Michael Dean blows for a foul. Arsenal have a free kick.

annotations.label: time
annotations.description: Fourth official shows 1 min. of added time.
Kieran Trippier (Burnley) is penalised after knocking an opponent down. Arsenal get a free kick.
Michael Dean blows his whistle for a foul after Danny Ings (Burnley) hacks down one of his opponents. It's a free kick to Arsenal in a dangerous position.
A pass by Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) ends up in no man's land, and the attacking effort comes to an end. The referee and the linesman both signal a throw in for Burnley.
David Ospina (Arsenal) sends a long ball across the pitch, but it misses its target.
A pass by Danny Ings (Burnley) ends up in no man's land, and the attacking effort comes to an end. The ball is out of play. Arsenal will take a throw in.
The ball is cleared after Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) attempted to dribble past an opposing player. The ball is behind the touchline and Arsenal will take a throw in.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) fails to pick a body out in the box with an over hit chip pass.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) tries to take the opposition by surprise with a quick free kick into the box.
David Jones (Burnley) clearly holds his opponent to prevent him from getting the ball and the referee blows his whistle for a foul. That's a free kick to Arsenal.
Ashley Barnes (Burnley) makes a rough challenge and Michael Dean blows his whistle for a foul.
The free kick is delivered by Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) but it's not one of his best and is easily cleared.
Scott Arfield (Burnley) commits an ugly challenge. The referee sees it and immediately blows his whistle. Arsenal win a free kick and will be able to apply some pressure on the opposition goal.
Arsenal keep possession of the ball with some short passes, waiting for the moment to hit the opposition swiftly on the break.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) commits a foul and Michael Dean immediately signals a free kick. A free kick has been awarded to Burnley.
Kieran Trippier (Burnley) produces a dangerous lofted cross into the box which is intercepted.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) sends over a cross from the side into the penalty area in order to find one of his teammates, but he fails and the opportunity goes begging.
Kieran Trippier (Burnley) sends a lofted cross into the box which is headed clear.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Michael Duff (Burnley) attempts to discuss the decision with Michael Dean, but he soon realises that it's not the right thing to do as he sees the yellow.
Santi Cazorla (Arsenal) sends the resulting free kick a whisker wide of the left post!
David Jones (Burnley) commits a foul after making a slide tackle on his opponent. Arsenal will take a free kick.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Today's referee Michael Dean rightly decides to book Ben Mee (Burnley) for his harsh tackle.
Kieran Trippier (Burnley) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the left post only for David Ospina to dive and make a save.
Dangerous play by Laurent Koscielny (Arsenal). Michael Dean blows his whistle for a foul. A free kick has been awarded to Burnley.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) handles the ball and everyone in the stadium shouts 'handball'.
Ashley Barnes (Burnley) connects with a pass but sees his shot from the edge of the box blocked.

Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) didn't hesitate to knock his opponent down with a harsh sliding tackle. Michael Dean could probably show him a yellow, but he only goes with blowing the whistle for a foul. Burnley will take a free kick nearby the side line.
Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) looks to break free, but an opposing player clears the ball away. The ball has crossed the sideline. Arsenal are taking a throw in.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) works the corner short.
Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) slaloms his way past challenges, but an opposing player does well to get the ball away. Arsenal force a corner. They send men into the box.
The referee blows his whistle, a clear handball by David Jones (Burnley).
Scott Arfield (Burnley) sends a chip pass into the box, but David Ospina is quickest to intercept the ball.
The linesman raises his flag for offside before Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) heads on.
The goalkeeper is not tested by the free kick from the edge of the box by David Jones (Burnley) as his effort only hit the wall.

Francis Coquelin (Arsenal) is obviously not following the Golden Rule: „Treat others as you want to be treated.“ He makes a bad challenge and leaves Michael Dean with no other option than to blow for a foul. Burnley have a free kick from a promising distance.
Danny Ings (Burnley) whips the ball in, but it fails to reach any of his teammates as the opposition's defence averts the threat.
Scott Arfield (Burnley) pulls the shirt of his opponent and the referee stops play for a foul.
Kieran Trippier (Burnley) fails to send a pass into the box as his effort is cut out. The ball is out of play. Burnley will have a throw in.
Hector Bellerin (Arsenal) attempts to find his teammate with a pass from outside the box, but the opposition's defence is quick to react and thwarts the attack.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: One of the defending players stopped the first attempt, but the ball lands at the feet of Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) and he unleashes a shot which goes into the top right corner, ricocheting in off the post.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.
Tom Heaton pulls off a great save to deny Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Ashley Barnes (Burnley) finds himself beyond the last defender, but the game is stopped by the referee after the linesman signals for offside.

Nacho Monreal (Arsenal) passes the ball from the edge of the box in order to find his teammate, who is in a good scoring position, but the defender blocks the pass and spanks the ball to safety. It's a throw in for Arsenal.
Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) tries to hit a shot towards goal from long range, but he miskicks the ball and it flies high over the crossbar.
George Boyd (Burnley) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) strikes the rebound, but it goes well over the bar.
Sam Vokes (Burnley) races towards goal but the defender gets back well to make a challenge.
Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) goes on a solo run, but he fails to create a chance as an opposition player blocks him. The linesman signals a throw in for Burnley.
A cross from Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) fails to reach the box as the defence clears the ball away to safety.
Hector Bellerin (Arsenal) sends a teasing cross into the area, but Tom Heaton intercepts the ball.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, but it is straight at Tom Heaton.
Kieran Trippier (Burnley) pulls the shirt of his opponent and only escapes without punishment due to the benevolence of the referee. Arsenal have a free kick.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: The first half has just begun.
The players are on the pitch and Arsenal will have the kick off.
Michael Dean got the nomination for today's game and will try his best to be a fair judge and not make any mistakes.

annotations.label: lineup1
annotations.description: You can have a look at the starting XIs of both teams in the details of this match.
Hello and welcome to our live text commentary! We will provide you with instant updates of everything that happens in the match. The starting lineups will be announced very soon.

We have been watching a lacklustre game with only a few moments to excite the crowd. The players surely have better abilities, they just needed to motivate themselves a little more. It was a very tight match, with not much between the two teams. The home team really focused on a well organized defence, while the away team played possession football.
